addressleaf.section:
To my LL. of
e Counsel. July 13 1591.

page.lettertext:
fol.179r
Belgia: 1591. July
Belgia 1 591 13 July To the Lords of the Councell
May it please yo
r
good LL. to be ad
v
tised, that I Rxd
yo
r
letter of the 13 of June, the 9th of this p
n
t
being then at
e camp betwene
Devent
r
& Arnham, It
was adressed unto me from
Midelburg
, the 1 of
is p
n
t
by one,
t
Rxd it there of
e
comissary Sparahauk
e last
of June. w
ch
I do specifie so precisely, to let yo
r
LL
und
r
stand,
t
by reason
t
letter was so long upon
e
waie, I could answer no sooner to
t
that was
required. Having signified to
Comt Maurice
what her
Ma
ty
required for
e arming of 10. shippes of
t
burden
& w
th
such provision as yo
r
LL. write unto me, he desired
me for answer to signify againe, that hee had no
authority at all to dispose of
e shipping of these
provinces, unles yt were at home, & for
e ordinary
s
vice of
e Countrey. It was a matt
r
belonging to the
assembly of
e States, w
ch
hee douted very much would
resolve to do nothing, unles they had theyr warrant from
the Provinces in
ticular; Also hee shewed me that
ther was no shippes of warre in these countrys of a
100 tonnes as her Ma
ty
doth require, & that, 5 of theyr
greatest are alredy employed upon
e coast of
France
at
e King
requisition. I receavd
e lik answer
fr
o
e
Councel of State
, to whom I made
e like ouverture
as I did unto
e Court, & as by order from
her Ma
ty
/
But because yt was a matt
r
that went beyond theyr
commission, I delt both w
th
th
e
& w
th
Comt Maurice
to recommend yt effectually to
e
g
n
al states
& to
signify unto th
e
, that although they had no shipping
of theyr owne of
e same burden, they might make
provisyon of marchant
shipps, & appropriat them easily
for
e
s
vice, or oth
r
wise they mighte induce
e marchant
to
adventure for th
e
selves promising unto th
e
as I had
proposed a ratable share of e
v
y prise in proportion to
theyr charge. To this effect they have written in as
effectuall manner as I coud desyre, & I have sent
theyr instant request w
th
mine owne to
e generall states
fol.179v
Belgia: 1591. July.
w
th
instant request, that for winning of time, they would direct
theyr letters of answer not unto me where I am at
is p
n
t
but ether to her Ma
ty
or yo
r
LL. or to theyr agent
m
r
Caron
to be reported to her Hig
nes
. & this is as much as possibly
I can effect, unles yo
r
LL l
re
had come sooner to my hand
w
ch
I am also much in dout, lest
e g
n
al states will
alleage for theyr excuse. For
e state of all thing
heer in these martiall affairs, because my
L. Treasuror
hath alwaies vouchsafed to acquaint both her Ma
ty
&
yo
r
LL w
th
e ocurrences of my letters, I p
r
sume in
t
respect upon his L. speciall care & yo
r
honorable favor
in
e acceptance of my service,
And so I take &c.
Fr
o
Arnham, July 13. 1591
